page.title: 03Changing Methodist attitudes
page.content: Since Wesley's day Methodism has exerted strong influence in the area both morally and politically. General Booth was converted in Skelmanthorpe. There are two Wesleyan Reform Union churches. The Denby Dale circuit has 4{chapels}in this area and two ministers preach in the circuit supported by lay preachers. Congregations are generally falling and no new churches are being built in the area. Several have closed or amalgamated in modernised buildings. Many chapels remain very active with Sunday Schools and other activities such as play and youth groups. Most congregations are of older people but some chapels have succeeded in attracting whole families. Local people feel that more needs to be done to attract people, if Methodism is to survive in these villages.
